results.title: M'eza (preview for an interactive installation)
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Anita Bacic
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. M’eza is an immersive art-piece screened at Videobrasil Electronic Art festival 2003. Artist should be contacted at a later date for a further explanation of the work

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Luz
results.brief_description: 128…129…129…a walk through a wondrous neighbourhood that only a child could imagine. A little girl plays in the street while her mother calls her home, wherever we find it.

results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.

results.title: Luther Metke at 94
results.creator_credit: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
results.brief_description: A portrait of Luther Metke who has lived in this Cascade Mountains of Oregon since 1907. Tells how he was a veteran of the Spanish American War, an early labor organiser, a poet, and a builder, and today serves as a vital and lucid example of the rural ethic in America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Raymen, Jorge Preloran, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program

results.title: Lust in the dust
results.creator_credit: Paul Bartel, Tab Hunter, Alan Glaser, New World Pictures and Fox Run Productions
results.brief_description: This camp, affectionate spoof of B western films, features drag-queen and cult-movie star Divine (1945-1988) best known for her performances in the films of John Waters. Basically a series of comedy skits that draw heavily on stereotypes of the western genre, the plot revolves around a group of mis-assorted characters that converge on the frontier town of Chile Verde in search of buried gold. Soon the town is turned upside down as lust, greed, and passion are driven to a fever pitch. Divine plays Rosie Velez, a voluptuous barmaid who encounters Clint Eastwood-esque gunfighter, Abel Wood (played by veteran actor Tab Hunter) in the desert. The performances of the cast of seasoned comic actors make up for the shortcomings of the script in this silly but fun, raunchy romp through a very wild Old West. Cast also includes Geoffrey Lewis, Laine Kazan, Cesar Romero and Henry Silva.

results.title: Lust and revenge
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Jane Ballantyne and Illumination Films (AU)
results.brief_description: Georgina Oliphant commissions her friend Lily to create a sculpture for a new wing at the National Gallery. Her father sees it as an opportunity for a healthy tax deduction. Karl Heinz, who is chosen as the model for the sculpture, sees it as a chance to buy a cottage in Handover. His wife Celia, who is heavily involved in a New Age religious group, isn’t so thrilled. Everyone wants something but who will ultimately win? The film twists and turns towards its hilarious conclusion. Nominated for Best Director in the 1996 AFI Awards, “Lust and Revenge” is a biting satire on the arts world and the financial imperatives driving it. However, the most powerful element of the film is the development of the characters as they are drawn into this Machiavillian power game. Look out for some wonderful cameo roles, particularly from Wendy Hughes and John Hargreaves.

results.title: Lungs
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Morgan and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: Discusses the structure, function and mechanism of the lungs. The overall structure of the lungs and air passage is presented by means of a sheep dissection and a living lung is seen during a routine operationat a veterinary clinic. The movement of the diaphragm and ribs is clearly highlighted by X-ray.
